body:
Comment 8: 
What you are missing is that Go is not C.
There is no fundamental reason for a \x00 at the end of
a string to have a special treatment except that it happens
to be what C does.  And C does it to avoid having to specify
a length.  Since Go specifies a length, there's no reason.

One of the biggest problems with C strings is that bad
things happen when you do manage to embed a \x00 in
the middle of the string and C only sees half of it.
